thread.title: Extradition Process Begins for Randy and Evi Quaid
thread.title_full: Extradition Process Begins for Randy and Evi Quaid

title: Extradition Process Begins for Randy and Evi Quaid
text:
/ News Extradition Process Begins for Randy and Evi Quaid The couple are alleged to have committed crimes in Santa Barbara County and have been on the run since 2010 Oscar Flores , KEYT-KCOY-KKFX Digital Journalist, oscar.flores@keyt.com POSTED: 01:48 PM PDT Oct 10, 2015 UPDATED: 01:48 PM PDT Oct 10, 2015 Tweet SANTA BARBARA COUNTY, Calif. - 
Randy and Evi Quaid are one step closer to being extradited to Santa Barbara County to face justice. Related Content Long-Lost Siblings Meet For The First Time After Decades... 
The couple are alleged to have committed crimes in Santa Barbara County that include breaking into a home on East Mountain Drive in Montecito. They have been on the run since 2010. 
On October 9, the Santa Barbara County Sheriff's Department and District Attorney's Office learned that the Quaids had been arrested by Vermont State Police. 
"They are being held in Vermont on $500,000 bail each on California warrant charges of felony vandalism, misdemeanor, trespass, and felony failure to appear in court while out on bail," said Kelly Hoover with the Santa Barbara County Sheriff's Office. 
The Quaids will be arraigned in Vermont State Court on Monday as the first step of the extradition process. 
"If Mr. and Mrs. Quaid are ordered to remain in custody pending release back to California, the Sheriffs Felony Fugitive Unit will coordinate their return back to California to face their outstanding charges," said Hoover.
